chapter.title: Packaging and Deploying Your Documentation
chapter.para: For deploying the documentation as RPM packages and integrating it into KDE and GNOME desktop environments as well as into Web user interfaces (via JSP), &dapsacr; offers a number of options to produce the corresponding output: For example, you can create source packages, HTML tarballs, color PDFs, and files for the KDE or GNOME help system with the daps package-* commands.
Find a list of the most important commands below. taroth 2013-01-17: fsundermeyer: I guess online-docs is too special to mention here?

varlistentry.term: Generating an HTML Archive Plus Desktop, Document, or Page Files

listitem.para: Generates HTML output and packs the HTML files, any graphics, and your CSS file) into a tarball. Additionally generates a *.pages file that you can use for the GNOME help system Yelp. If you need files for former Yelp versions, use the --documentfiles option. To generate files for the KDE3 help system, use the --desktopfiles option instead.
Creates all archives and files needed for packaging a JSP document.

varlistentry.term: Generating a Color PDF Plus Desktop, Document, or Page Files

listitem.para: Generates a color PDF. Additionally generates a *.pages file that you can use for the GNOME help system Yelp. If you need files for former Yelp versions, use the --documentfiles option. To generate files for the KDE3 help system, use the --desktopfiles option instead.
To tell &dapsacr; which the formatter to use for creation of the PDF, add the option --formatter=FORMATTER .

varlistentry.term: Creating a Tarball with All Sources (Including Graphics)

listitem.para: Generates a distributable tarball containing the sources of the complete set including the graphics. For details about profiling in DocBook and how to use it with &dapsacr;, refer to .
